activities.name: Visit Keukenhof Gardens (nearby)
activities.description: Experience the world-famous Keukenhof Gardens in nearby Lisse, showcasing millions of tulips, daffodils, and hyacinths in breathtaking displays. A quintessential Dutch spring experience.
activities.seasonal_notes: Only open for approx. 8 weeks in spring. Peak bloom varies slightly each year but is usually mid-April.
activities.booking_tips: Book tickets and transport (e.g., combi-ticket with bus from Haarlem/Schiphol) well in advance, especially for weekends and peak bloom. Go early on a weekday to avoid the biggest crowds.

activities.name: King's Day (Koningsdag) in Haarlem
activities.description: Haarlem celebrates King's Day with enthusiasm! Enjoy city-wide flea markets ('vrijmarkt'), live music, decorated boats on the Spaarne, orange-clad crowds, and street parties.
activities.seasonal_notes: April 27th (or 26th if 27th is a Sunday). Busy and festive atmosphere, especially around the Grote Markt and along the Spaarne.
activities.booking_tips: Wear orange! Explore different areas like the Grote Markt and Vijfhoek. City center access is limited.

activities.name: Bloemencorso Bollenstreek (Flower Parade)
activities.description: Witness the spectacular annual flower parade travelling from Noordwijk to Haarlem, featuring floats adorned with thousands of flowers.
activities.best_time: One Saturday in April (check specific date)
activities.seasonal_notes: The parade arrives in Haarlem in the evening, creating a festive atmosphere. The floats are often displayed in Haarlem the following day.
activities.booking_tips: Find a viewing spot along the route in Haarlem early, especially near the city center. Check the official route and timings.

activities.name: Enjoy Haarlemmerhout Park
activities.description: Stroll through the oldest public park in the Netherlands as it bursts into spring bloom. Enjoy the deer park, pavilions, and walking paths.
activities.seasonal_notes: Beautiful awakening of nature in a historic park setting.
activities.booking_tips: Combine with a visit to the adjacent Frans Hals Museum (Hal location) or nearby neighborhoods.

activities.name: Terrace Season Opening in Haarlem
activities.description: Haarlem's charming terraces on the Grote Markt, Botermarkt, and along the Spaarne river reopen. Enjoy the first al fresco drinks and bites.
activities.seasonal_notes: Starts gaining popularity from March/April as weather permits.
activities.booking_tips: Pick a spot with a view of St. Bavo's or the Spaarne. Sunny spots fill quickly.

activities.name: Beach Day at Zandvoort or Bloemendaal aan Zee
activities.description: Take a short train or bike ride to the nearby coastal towns. Enjoy swimming, sunbathing, beach clubs, watersports, and the North Sea breeze.
activities.price_range: Budget (transport/own snacks) to High (fancy beach clubs)
activities.seasonal_notes: Very popular during summer. Bloemendaal often has more trendy beach clubs, Zandvoort is a larger resort town.
activities.booking_tips: Go early on sunny weekends as trains and beaches get crowded. Consider renting a bike in Haarlem for a scenic ride through the dunes.

activities.name: Haarlem Jazz & More Festival
activities.description: Free multi-day music festival featuring jazz, soul, funk, and related genres on stages across the city center, mainly around the Grote Markt.
activities.best_time: Evenings (Several days in August - check dates)
activities.seasonal_notes: Creates a fantastic, lively atmosphere in the heart of Haarlem.
activities.booking_tips: Check the performance schedule and wander between stages. Grab drinks from surrounding bars.

activities.name: Canal Cruise or Boat Rental on the Spaarne
activities.description: Enjoy Haarlem from the water. Take a guided canal cruise or rent a small electric boat ('sloep') to explore the Spaarne river and canals at your own pace.
activities.seasonal_notes: Ideal way to see the city's gables, bridges, and waterside life in summer.
activities.booking_tips: Book boat rentals in advance, especially on weekends. Cruises depart regularly near Teylers Museum.

activities.name: Outdoor Dining & Drinks (Grote Markt, Botermarkt)
activities.description: Peak season for Haarlem's vibrant terrace culture. Enjoy long summer evenings dining and drinking outdoors on the main squares and charming side streets.
activities.seasonal_notes: The city buzzes with outdoor activity. Botermarkt often has a slightly more local feel than Grote Markt.
activities.booking_tips: Reservations recommended for dinner, especially at popular spots.

activities.name: Cycle Tour through Zuid-Kennemerland National Park
activities.description: Rent bikes and explore the beautiful dune landscapes between Haarlem and the coast. Trails wind through forests, dunes, and past small lakes.
activities.seasonal_notes: A refreshing escape from the city heat, chance to see wildlife (like Highland cattle or deer).
activities.booking_tips: Plan your route using park maps. Combine with a beach visit.

activities.name: Visit Museums (Frans Hals, Teylers)
activities.description: Ideal weather for delving into Haarlem's world-class museums. Explore the Dutch Masters at the Frans Hals Museum or the unique collections at Teylers Museum.
activities.seasonal_notes: Perfect for cooler or rainy days. Check for temporary exhibitions.
activities.booking_tips: Book tickets online to save time, especially for weekend visits.

activities.name: Explore Hofjes in Autumn Light
activities.description: Discover Haarlem's hidden almshouse courtyards, which take on a special atmosphere with autumn colors and softer light.
activities.seasonal_notes: Quieter than summer, offering a peaceful exploration experience. Remember to respect residents' privacy.
activities.booking_tips: Grab a hofjes walking route map from the tourist information office (VVV).

activities.name: Cozy Cafes & Pubs
activities.description: Enjoy the 'gezelligheid' of Haarlem's cafes with warm drinks and apple pie, or settle into a traditional pub for local beers and snacks ('borrelhapjes').
activities.seasonal_notes: Perfect for escaping chilly weather. Many pubs feature seasonal 'bokbier'.
activities.booking_tips: Explore side streets off the Grote Markt for charming, less crowded options.

activities.name: Shopping in the 'Gouden Straatjes'
activities.description: Browse the unique boutiques, antique shops, and specialty stores in Haarlem's famed 'Golden Streets' (e.g., Kleine Houtstraat, Warmoesstraat) as they prepare for the festive season.
activities.seasonal_notes: A pleasant indoor activity with unique finds.
activities.booking_tips: Allow ample time for browsing these charming shopping streets.

activities.name: Attend Concerts at Philharmonie or Patronaat
activities.description: Check the autumn schedules for classical concerts at the Philharmonie or contemporary music gigs at the renowned Patronaat venue.
activities.seasonal_notes: The main cultural season kicks off in autumn.
activities.booking_tips: Book tickets online in advance for popular acts or performances.

activities.name: Christmas Market & Winter Atmosphere
activities.description: Haarlem hosts one of the largest and most atmospheric Christmas markets in the Netherlands, typically over one weekend in December. Enjoy hundreds of stalls, festive lights, music, and glühwein.
activities.seasonal_notes: The entire city center transforms into a festive wonderland. Very popular and crowded.
activities.booking_tips: Check the official dates well in advance. Visit earlier in the day for slightly smaller crowds. Book accommodation early if staying overnight.

activities.name: Ice Skating (Temporary Rink)
activities.description: Often, a temporary outdoor ice skating rink is set up on one of the main squares (location can vary) during the winter months.
activities.seasonal_notes: Availability and location depend on yearly organisation. Check local announcements.
activities.booking_tips: Usually no booking needed, pay at the entrance. Dress warmly.

activities.name: Sinterklaas Arrival (Intocht) in Haarlem
activities.description: Welcome Sinterklaas and his helpers as they arrive by boat on the Spaarne river, usually followed by a festive parade through the city.
activities.seasonal_notes: A magical event primarily for children, marking the start of the Sinterklaas gift-giving season.
activities.booking_tips: Find a good viewing spot along the Spaarne or the parade route early.

activities.name: Warm Up in Museums and Cafes
activities.description: Escape the cold by visiting Haarlem's excellent museums (Frans Hals, Teylers, Museum van de Geest) or enjoying hot chocolate and pastries in cozy cafes.
activities.seasonal_notes: Perfect way to spend a cold or wet winter day.
activities.booking_tips: Check museum opening times, especially around holidays.

activities.name: New Year's Dive (Nieuwjaarsduik) at Zandvoort
activities.description: Join thousands of brave souls for the traditional Dutch New Year's Dive into the chilly North Sea at nearby Zandvoort beach.
activities.price_range: Free (to watch) / Small fee (often, to participate, includes hat)
activities.seasonal_notes: A unique, albeit cold, Dutch tradition. Spectating is also popular.
activities.booking_tips: Check the official Zandvoort event details for timing and registration if participating. Dress VERY warmly if spectating!

activities.name: Enjoy Oliebollen and Winter Treats
activities.description: Find street stalls ('kramen') selling traditional Dutch winter treats like 'oliebollen' (doughnuts) and 'appelflappen' (apple turnovers), especially prevalent around Christmas and New Year.
activities.seasonal_notes: A delicious warm treat on a cold day.
activities.booking_tips: Look for stalls near shopping areas or the Grote Markt. Best enjoyed fresh and warm.
